column2: Source: Statistics Canada, Households and the Environment Survey
As a percentage of all households.
May add up to more than 100% as some households have more than one type of vehicle.
As a percentage of households that had any type of hybrid vehicle.
As a percentage of households that had a non-plugin hybrid vehicle.
As a percentage of households that had a plugin hybrid vehicle.
As a percentage of households that had a pure electric vehicle.
Excludes pure electric vehicles where the distance driven was not reported.
Adds up to more than 100% as more than one charging location could be reported.
Excludes households that did not report all locations at which their pure electric vehicles were charged.
As a percentage of households that had a charging station at home.
May add up to more than 100% as some households have more than one type of charging station at home.
Level 1 charging stations use 120 volts and recharge a rechargeable vehicle at a rate of about 200 kilometres of range in 20 hours.
Level 2 charging stations use 240 volts and recharge a rechargeable vehicle at a rate of about 30 kilometres of range an hour.
